thread.title: Meghan Markle poses with close friends for charity campaign: 'You inspire me' - 9Honey
thread.title_full: Meghan Markle poses with close friends for charity campaign: 'You inspire me' - 9Honey

author: Jo Abi
title: Meghan Markle poses with close friends for charity campaign: 'You inspire me' - 9Honey
text:
Meghan, the Duchess of Sussex , has lent her support to one of her closest friends for charity organisation Alliance of Moms .
Meghan , 42, posed for photos wearing a t-shirt which reads "Love Like a Mother" alongside co-founder Kelly McKee Zajfen and friend and former Suits co-star Abigail Spencer.
The trio wore the matching white t-shirts with red font and blue jeans in a series of three snaps. ﻿The photos have been shared on social media long with a message from Zajfen.
﻿READ MORE: Legendary American rocker dies aged 80
Meghan Markle has lent her support to one of her closest friends for charity organisation Alliance of Moms. (Instagram/Alliance of Moms) "When we speak about the people in our lives who lift us up when you need it with undeniable force of pure love I think of these two.
"You inspire me. You pick me up when I need it and you Love Like A Mother!" she stated.
"Thank you for continuing to support the @allianceofmoms , for supporting this campaign and our youth. In doing so, you are supporting the mission to build bright futures for young parents who have experienced foster care."
READ MORE: The pantry staple that﻿'s rocketed in price by up to 93%
The photos are for the organisaton's 'Love Like a Mother' campaign. (Instagram/Alliance of Moms) The trio donned the matching white t-shirts with red font and blue jeans in a series of three snaps. (Instagram/Alliance of Moms) Proceeds from the T-shirts "support essential services, education, and advocacy so that young parents in foster care and their children can heal and thrive".
﻿Alliance of Moms was co-founded by Zajfen alongside Danika Charity, Yasmine Delawari Johnson and Jules Leyser. It describes itself as "a community of philanthropists who support pregnant and parenting youth in LA's foster care system so that they can build a positive future for themselves and their children."
Zajfen lost her son George, who died aged nine in July 2022 after a sudden illness.
READ MORE: Ways to keep warm in winter we bet you haven't thought of
Zajfen lost her son George, who died aged just nine in July 2022 after a sudden illness. (Instagram) She wrote in PEOPLE : "We had no idea when we took him into the hospital that 12 hours later, he would not make it. My nine-year-old son George died. Died of Covid and viral meningitis. A healthy and vibrant boy could not fight it. We lost him. I kissed him. But it was to say goodbye.﻿"
Zajfen is also the owner and creative director of little minis, a children's clothing line that uses mostly leftover fabrics of brands and manufacturers who have over-ordered fabric, or textile mills that have overproduced in its designs.﻿
READ MORE: The best way to see Hawaii is on a cruise
Meghan is the latest celebrity to appear in the campaign. (Instagram) ﻿This isn't the first time the Duchess of Sussex has lent her support to the organisation. In 2023 she took part in the Alliance of Moms CommUNITY of Motherhood campaign.
Zajfen has spoken of the support she's received from Meghan previously.﻿
"You are always the first to say yes and support those you love," she said.
"You are a fierce advocate for those who are in need. Thank you for joining this year's campaign to support LA's expectant and parenting foster youth, which helps provide critical services, education, resources and advocacy so they can build a better future for themselves and their families."
Other celebrities too appear in the "Love Like a Mother" Campaign include The Sopranos star ﻿Jamie-Lynn Sigler and Kristen Bell.
The Duchess of Sussex soft-launched her lifestyle brand this week with strawberry jam. (Instagram) Earlier this week the Duchess of Sussex soft-launched her lifestyle brand American Riviera Orchard with it's first product, strawberry jam, which was sent to 50 lucky friends and influencers. These included Tracy Robbins, the fashion designer and wife of Paramount CEO Brian Robbins, and Delfina Blaquier, the wife of Prince Harry's friend and ﻿polo partner 'Nacho' Figueras.﻿
Both praised the spread, sharing photos on Instagram.﻿﻿
"Thank you for the delicious basket! I absolutely love this jam so not sure I'm sharing with anyone," she Robbins wrote.
Blaquier also shared photos of the product along with the caption: "Strawberry jam makes me happy."﻿
